raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Gastric adenocarcinoma", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Gastric adenocarcinoma is a malignant tumor arising from the epithelial lining of the stomach, making it an epithelial tumor. Lymphoma is a malignancy of lymphoid tissue, GIST (gastrointestinal stromal tumor) arises from mesenchymal cells, and carcinoid tumors originate from neuroendocrine cells. Only gastric adenocarcinoma is of epithelial origin."}
